executive_summary: The Lumber Wholesaling industry has experienced a slight decline over the past five years, as the industry has faced volatile economic conditions, supply chain disruptions and fluctuations in downstream construction markets.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Lumber is an essential element in the construction
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Companies in the Lumber Wholesaling industry distribute lumber, plywood, millwork and wood panel products to residential, industrial and commercial construction companies, hardware stores and carpentry contractors in the United States.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Interest rate hikes have chopped down growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Interest rates have been volatile in recent years and, therefore, so has the residential construction market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Lumber selling prices have been volatile
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Many lumber products are considered almost identical and widely available from other wholesalers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Shifting Consumer Preferences Syphon Demand at the Edges
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Metal products have become more popular for doors, windows and frames since they typically cost less.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Falling Interest Rates Will Encourage Residential Construction
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Federal Reserve is expected to begin cuts in 2024, which will encourage residential construction activity.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Nonresidential Construction Will Grow Despite High Interest Rates
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Segments of nonresidential construction such as office space expansion will be lifted by restored business sentiment.
After hitting historic highs during the coronavirus prices will normalize.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Fragmentation Will Remain the Norm, But Some Companies Will Buck This Trend
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry's profit is likely to stagnate over the next five years.

industry_definition: This industry distributes a range of lumber, plywood, millwork and wood panel products to contractors, home improvement stores and hardware stores.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

opportunities: Demand from lumber and building material stores

key_trends: Price-based competition is a hallmark of the industry.
Interest rates heavily influence lumber demand.
Metal is creeping in as a wood alternative.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Market includes construction markets who purchase lumber for both residential and non-residential construction.
Includes hardware and home improvement stores that service do-it-yourself construction activity.
Includes other wholesalers who purchase products from specialized wholesalers.
Includes households, restaurants and businesses that need lumber and plywood.
Includes households, restaurants, businesses and government agencies.

products_and_services.product_description: The lumber and boards segment includes lumber that is supplied rough, finished or dressed.
Includes wood millwork and metal millwork.
Includes plywood, wood panels and engineered wood products.
Includes firewood, pulpwood, fiberboard, wallboard and gypsum products.

tier_1_suppliers: Wood Paneling Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Wood Pulp Mills in the US
Wood Product Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Industrial Building Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of housing starts largely affects demand for the Lumber Wholesaling industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the nation's largest producer of lumber.
Lumber wholesalers favor the West due to high construction activity in California.
Wholesalers in the Great Lakes benefit from ready access to raw materials.

regulations_points.regulation_description: General regulations covering storage and transportation of goods.
Prohibits trade in illegally procured lumber.

basis_points.basis_description: Retailers look for the lowest-priced lumber products.
Wholesalers with diverse product ranges are favored.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Diverse downstream markets contribute to low concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: The Lumber Wholesaling industry caters to a wide range of markets.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the Largest Expense Category
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wholesalers purchase lumber and millwork products from manufacturers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Capital Spending Focused on Upgrading IT
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Most notably, operators are adopting computer inventory systems.

volatility_points.volatility_title: CYCLICAL NATURE OF THE CONSTRUCTION MARKET IS RESPONSIBLE FOR VOLATILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry is susceptible to fluctuations in the residential construction market.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: INCREASING AUTOMATION PROCESSES IS A KEY INNOVATION
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Automated systems utilize advanced technology to perform routine tasks.

FAQs.question: How have your sales been affected by the growth of online shopping?
FAQs.answer: Operators do not experience intense competition from online operators.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on any one market, major customer or other isolated revenue stream?
FAQs.answer: Sales are heavily dependent on the residential housing market.
